name: Pulmonaria
description: Pulmonaria is a genus of about 15 species of perennials in the family Boraginaceae, native to Europe and Asia.These shade-loving plants produce hairy leaves in varying shades of green and small funnel-shaped flowers in a variety of colors. They bloom in late winter or early spring, bringing a bright spot of color to our gardens.
meaning: The genus name was derived from the Latin “pulmo”, which means “lung”, because the spotted leaves of Pulmonaria were thought to resemble diseased lungs.
color_description: The flowers come in shades of blue, purple, pink and white.
